channel.title: Ban Logic
channel.description:
We have reviewed your account, and have decided to not grant your appeal. You have continued to break our rules, time and time again, and due to the severity of these offences as well as your attitude within RuneScape, we have decided that your account will remain permanently banned. Any messages sent regarding this account will be ignored, and we ask that you re-read all of the rules if you wish to create another account. RuneScape Customer Support
Which is strange because....
29-Oct-2006 Breaking Rule 7 Apology Made Info View Evidence
Is the ONLY offense, so, either Jagex employees cannot count/nor spell(offenses, not "offences"), or they have an automated bot that simply denies ALL appeals except for a few key words which are only known to them. These are merely generalizations about their system, plainly put, I believe Jagex to be a hack it up cron job as far as actual customer support/appeal process goes. I severely doubt a "person" ever reviews the case. This is not a ban topic, this is a discussion on how to circumvent the ban logics... We know already that the "unban" is automated, [b]suicide[/b] was a previous keyword. So, has anyone found any new keywords or would care to share possible keywords?

item.title: Ban Logic
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:3, topic:164469”]A few years ago, though, I had an interesting chat with a few mods, trying to remove my forum mute. I can’t verify now, but it seems if you say some jagex mod names in your report, a human will deal with it. A few times it was an automated response, other times it was humans.[/quote]This is true. I like to appoint messages to Mod Gabriel, for she seems to be at least a bit intelligent. I’ve had many discussions with her in the past and is one of the only J Mods I don’t dislike. Some of the others just ignore me.

Read full topic

item.title: Ban Logic
item.dc:creator: @billygotshot billygotshot
item.description:
@billygotshot wrote:

depends on when you appeal… if you appeal at night when they are not working you will get a bot and get fucked… If you appeal when it is not night then you might have a better chance…

Read full topic

item.title: Ban Logic
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

I had the exact same message and I too had never broken any rules (Well, been caught), they’re either busy or laughing at your pety attempt to regain the right to play.

Read full topic

item.title: Ban Logic
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

sh!ft:

Is the ONLY offense, so, either Jagex employees cannot count/nor spell(offenses, not “offences”)…

You know this is a British company right?
Offence is correct in most English speaking countries such as Canada, but not in the USA of course… :rolleyes:
Americans speak American.

-Mh

Read full topic

item.title: Ban Logic
item.dc:creator: @sh_ft sh!ft
item.description:
@sh_ft wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:3, topic:164469”]As far as I know, depending on what you were banned for, you can either get off easily or you won’t be unbanned at all. I recall no one being able to get off of macroing bans on f2p accounts, yet people abusing the filter only receiving mutes, and easily getting off of bans. But, it is ALWAYS an AI that is on the other end of the Customer Support.

A few years ago, though, I had an interesting chat with a few mods, trying to remove my forum mute. I can’t verify now, but it seems if you say some jagex mod names in your report, a human will deal with it. A few times it was an automated response, other times it was humans.[/quote]

Well, to the contrary of the first sentence of yours, there was a bug that worked for all of like one or two weeks where you could simply put “suicide” in the appeal box, hit enter. And you’d be unbanned for a couple of days, just long enough to pull off your “10 phat sets”, and other duped items.

Edit: I know for sure I read something back in RSC, when the “blackmark” system was being developed, that stated some prevalent information on its internal cogs… However the only sentence I can remember from the post was something like “3 blackmarks is an automatic ban” or something like that.

Read full topic

item.title: Ban Logic
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

As far as I know, depending on what you were banned for, you can either get off easily or you won’t be unbanned at all. I recall no one being able to get off of macroing bans on f2p accounts, yet people abusing the filter only receiving mutes, and easily getting off of bans. But, it is ALWAYS an AI that is on the other end of the Customer Support.

A few years ago, though, I had an interesting chat with a few mods, trying to remove my forum mute. I can’t verify now, but it seems if you say some jagex mod names in your report, a human will deal with it. A few times it was an automated response, other times it was humans.

Read full topic

item.title: Ban Logic
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

First of all, did you appeal or apologize? Appeal makes them review it… Apologies are useless.

Second of all, I don’t think macros are appealable.

Read full topic

We have reviewed your account, and have decided to not grant your appeal. You have continued to break our rules, time and time again, and due to the severity of these offences as well as your attitude within RuneScape, we have decided that your account will remain permanently banned.

Any messages sent regarding this account will be ignored, and we ask that you re-read all of the rules if you wish to create another account.

RuneScape Customer Support

Is the ONLY offense, so, either Jagex employees cannot count/nor spell(offenses, not “offences”), or they have an automated bot that simply denies ALL appeals except for a few key words which are only known to them.

These are merely generalizations about their system, plainly put, I believe Jagex to be a hack it up cron job as far as actual customer support/appeal process goes. I severely doubt a “person” ever reviews the case.

This is not a ban topic, this is a discussion on how to circumvent the ban logics… We know already that the “unban” is automated, suicide was a previous keyword.

So, has anyone found any new keywords or would care to share possible keywords?
